alert.note: Alert for Worcester (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 8:29AM EST until January 11 at 1:55PM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Massachusetts...Rhode Island... Blackstone River At Northbridge affecting Worcester County. Blackstone River At Woonsocket affecting Providence and Worcester Counties. Wood River At Hope Valley affecting Washington County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Rhode Island...Connecticut... Pawtuxet River At Cranston affecting Kent and Providence Counties. Pawcatuck River At Westerly affecting Washington and New London Counties. .Heavy rain will fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers will increase quickly and reach critical levels. For the Blackstone River...including Northbridge, Woonsocket... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Pawtuxet River...including Scituate Reservoir, Cranston... Major flooding is forecast. For the Pawcatuck River...including Wood River Junction, Westerly... Minor flooding is forecast. For the Wood River...including Hope Valley...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Blackstone River at Northbridge. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Flooding is expected along the river from Northbridge through Uxbridge and Millville. Flooding will affect some homes and businesses along the river in these towns. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:31 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 7.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 12.0 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.5 feet on 01/25/1979. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 830 PM EST.
